title: Rotational inertia - system with different axes

content.question: Two spheres, each of mass <math alttext="m " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, are attached to the ends of a bar of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and negligible mass. Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> shows the spheres-bar system, which has rotational inertia <math alttext="l sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, rotating about the center of the bar with angular velocity <math alttext="omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ω</mi></math>. Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> shows the system, which has rotational inertia <math alttext="l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, rotating with angular velocity <math alttext="the fraction omega over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> about the left sphere. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="l sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="l sub 1 equals the fraction l sub 2 over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="l sub 1 equals the fraction l sub 2 over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="l sub 1 equals l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="l sub 1 equals 2 l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="l sub 1 equals the fraction l sub 2 over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
